title: 17. The Res Gestae
description: The purpose, content, and historical value of Augustus’ Res Gestae as a self-presentation of his rule.

questions.question: When was the Res Gestae set up?
options: At the start of the Principate

questions.question: What Roman tradition did the Res Gestae follow?
Where were the original Res Gestae tablets displayed?
Why do historians still have access to the Res Gestae text?
options: Copies were set up across the empire

questions.question: What does the Res Gestae reveal about how Augustus wanted to be remembered?
options: As a restorer of the Republic

questions.question: What was one intended purpose of the Res Gestae after Augustus’ death?
What feature of the Res Gestae is unusual compared to normal inscriptions?
How does Augustus treat his family in the Res Gestae?
options: He largely omits them unless linked to honours

questions.question: Why does Augustus emphasise the title Pater Patriae?
options: To stress loyalty to his family
To highlight devotion to all of Rome

questions.question: How are Augustus’ enemies treated in the Res Gestae?
How are the provinces presented in the Res Gestae?
options: Mainly in the context of conquest

questions.question: What aspects of Augustus’ reign are largely omitted from the Res Gestae?
What claim does Augustus make about his political power?
options: That he held supreme power over colleagues
That he had no more power than other magistrates

questions.question: Why must historians treat the Res Gestae with caution?
options: It is a selective and self-promoting account
